alert.note: Alert for Northern Harrison; Northern Jackson; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:47AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison and Jackson Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Lucedale to 10 miles east of McHenry to 13 miles southeast of Poplarville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Gautier, D`iberville, Wade, Latimer, Big Point, Lyman, Saucier, Helena, Gulf Hills, Hurley, Vancleave, Gulf Park Estates and Hickory Hills. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 19 and 76. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Harrison; Northern Jackson; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson
